titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to Steam Boat H. M. Childs
CWG13792

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1865 Transportation, Ordinance (Stores), Arsenal, Postage, Subsistence/Forage, Contingencies; Left Stack

body.p:
No. 22.
The United States: State of Kentucky
To S. B H M Childs Dr

row.cell: For Transporting Ten (10) Prisoners of war from Paintsville Ky to Louisa Ky 30 Miles 2Â¢/mi
For Transporting Capt Alex Nichols Co and Forty Three ^43^ Privates from Paintsville Ky to Catlettsburgh Ky 75
For Transporting Capt J B Hutchison Co. L" Cols and Forty one (41) privts from Louisa Ky to Catlettsburgh Ky 30

body.p:
C. A. Finnegan
Maj. Comg 1st Batt. C. G.
I Certify, that the account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.

J,, B,, Maynard Lieut
& A. B.. Quartermaster 1st Ky
1st Bat C. G. Ky
Received at Frankfort Ky the 18 day of March 1865 of S. G. Suddarth, Quartermaster U.S. Army ^Genl of Ky^, the sum of Seventy four dollars, and ninety cents, in full of the above account.

J N Walkinford clerk
S. B. H. M. Childs

No. 22.
No. 26 Abstract B.2
March 18th 1865.
Steamer H M Childs
Dollars 74 90/100
Paid 18 of March 1865.
Transportation
231
